actions.committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.subcommittee: Postsecondary Education, Training and Life-Long Learning
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postsecondary Education, Training and Life-Long Learning.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Postsecondary Education, Training and Life-Long Learning

official_title: To amend the Workforce Investment Act of 1998 to provide increased flexibility for the transfer of within state allocations between adult and disclocated worker employment and training activities.

summary.text: Amends the Workforce Investment Act of 1998 to revise within-State allocation requirements to allow a local board that represents a local area with an unemployment rate of ten percent or more to transfer up to 35 percent (currently, 20 percent) of specified funds between adult employment and training activities and dislocated worker employment and training activities. (Retains the 20 percent limitation on such transfers for local boards representing local areas with unemployment rates of less than ten percent.)

titles.title: To amend the Workforce Investment Act of 1998 to provide increased flexibility for the transfer of within state allocations between adult and disclocated worker employment and training activities.
